cape_surface_jkg.name: CAPE
cape_surface_jkg.primary_goal: Measure total energy available for storm growth.
cape_surface_jkg.best_used_for: Assessing how violent storms could be if they fire.
cape_surface_jkg.limitations: High CAPE means nothing without a trigger (front, orography, sea breeze). CAPE alone doesn't tell you about storm organisation — you need shear for that.

thresholds.label: None
thresholds.meaning: Storms won't have any legs.

thresholds.label: Low
thresholds.meaning: Fair-weather cumulus, weak showers at best.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Typical summer thunderstorms if triggered.

thresholds.label: High
thresholds.meaning: Vigorous storms likely — significant turbulence, heavy rain.

thresholds.label: Extreme
thresholds.meaning: Severe storm potential — large hail, strong updrafts. Avoid at all costs.

cin_surface_jkg.name: CIN
cin_surface_jkg.vibe: The lid on the pressure cooker
cin_surface_jkg.primary_goal: Measure the energy barrier suppressing convection.
cin_surface_jkg.best_used_for: Judging whether storms will fire easily or need a strong trigger to break through.
cin_surface_jkg.limitations: CIN can erode quickly with afternoon heating. A strong cap at 09Z can vanish by 15Z. Check the trend, not just the snapshot.

thresholds.label: Weak cap
thresholds.meaning: Convection fires easily with modest heating or lift.

thresholds.label: Moderate cap
thresholds.meaning: Needs a front, sea-breeze, or strong heating to break. Storms delayed but can be intense.

thresholds.label: Strong cap
thresholds.meaning: Convection very unlikely unless a powerful trigger forces air through.

lifted_index.name: Lifted Index
lifted_index.vibe: Thumbs up / thumbs down for convection
lifted_index.best_used_for: A fast yes/no on whether thunderstorms are thermodynamically possible.
lifted_index.limitations: Only compares surface parcel to 500 hPa. Misses shallow convection below that level and elevated storms starting above the surface.

thresholds.label: Stable
thresholds.meaning: Surface air stays put at 500 hPa.

thresholds.label: Weak instability
thresholds.meaning: Bumpy cumulus, isolated showers.

thresholds.label: Moderate instability
thresholds.meaning: Thunderstorms likely with a trigger.

thresholds.label: Extreme instability
thresholds.meaning: Severe weather — strong updrafts, hail, turbulence.

showalter_index.name: Showalter Index
showalter_index.vibe: The Lifted Index's cautious older brother
showalter_index.primary_goal: Stability check using 850 hPa instead of the surface.
showalter_index.best_used_for: Spotting elevated instability when the surface is unrepresentative (cold mornings, inversions, frontal overrunning).
showalter_index.limitations: Ignores the surface layer entirely, so it will miss surface-based storms on hot afternoons where the LI would catch them.

thresholds.label: Stable
thresholds.meaning: No thunderstorm risk from elevated layers.

thresholds.label: Marginal
thresholds.meaning: Keep an eye on trends.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Elevated thunderstorms possible.

thresholds.label: Strong
thresholds.meaning: Severe elevated storms — dangerous because they can fire without surface heating.

k_index.name: K-Index
k_index.vibe: The minesweeper difficulty setting for your route
k_index.primary_goal: Estimate thunderstorm coverage in the area.
k_index.best_used_for: Deciding if you can fly direct or need to weave around cells.
k_index.limitations: Relies heavily on 700 hPa moisture. Over-predicts in tropical air masses and under-predicts in dry desert air.

thresholds.label: Stable
thresholds.meaning: Very stable atmosphere. No thunderstorm threat.

thresholds.label: Clear
thresholds.meaning: No air-mass storms expected.

thresholds.label: Isolated
thresholds.meaning: A few cells to dodge.

thresholds.label: Scattered
thresholds.meaning: Frequent deviations likely.

thresholds.label: Numerous
thresholds.meaning: Expect a wall of weather.

total_totals.name: Total Totals
total_totals.primary_goal: Combined measure of moisture and temperature lapse rate.
total_totals.best_used_for: Early warning of severe weather formation.
total_totals.limitations: Prone to false positives in cold-core low pressure systems where the air is naturally very cold aloft but convection is shallow.

thresholds.label: Quiet
thresholds.meaning: No significant storms.

thresholds.label: Scattered
thresholds.meaning: Scattered showers and isolated lightning.

thresholds.label: Isolated severe
thresholds.meaning: Heavy rain and strong winds possible.

thresholds.label: Numerous severe
thresholds.meaning: Widespread dangerous weather.

bulk_shear_0_6km_kt.name: Shear 0-6km
bulk_shear_0_6km_kt.primary_goal: Measure how organised storms will become.
bulk_shear_0_6km_kt.best_used_for: Predicting whether storms will be short-lived pop-ups or long-lived supercells.
bulk_shear_0_6km_kt.limitations: Shear alone doesn't create storms — you need instability too. High shear + no CAPE = windy but no convection.

thresholds.label: Weak
thresholds.meaning: Storms are disorganised and short-lived.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Organised multicells. Storms persist with heavy rain and gusty winds.

thresholds.label: Strong
thresholds.meaning: Supercell potential. Long-lived rotating storms.

bulk_shear_0_1km_kt.name: Shear 0-1km
bulk_shear_0_1km_kt.best_used_for: Assessing approach and departure safety — and tornado risk near storms.
bulk_shear_0_1km_kt.limitations: Model resolution smooths out local effects like downbursts and microbursts. Real shear on approach can be much worse.

thresholds.label: Light
thresholds.meaning: Normal operations.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Bumpy approaches, brief airspeed excursions.

thresholds.label: Significant
thresholds.meaning: Dangerous on approach/departure. Go-around risk.

freezing_level_ft.name: Freezing Level
freezing_level_ft.vibe: The icing floor — below here, ice melts off
freezing_level_ft.primary_goal: Mark the altitude where temperature crosses 0°C.
freezing_level_ft.best_used_for: The key reference for icing escape: descend below it to exit the icing zone.
freezing_level_ft.limitations: Can be multiple freezing levels in inversions. Model gives one value; real atmosphere can be messier.

thresholds.label: Very low
thresholds.meaning: Freezing near surface. Ground icing, very limited escape options.

thresholds.label: Low
thresholds.meaning: Limited room to descend below icing.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Reasonable icing-free zone below.

thresholds.label: High
thresholds.meaning: Large icing-free zone below. Descent escape strategy is viable.

minus10c_level_ft.name: -10°C Level
minus10c_level_ft.vibe: The peak danger altitude for icing
minus10c_level_ft.primary_goal: Mark the altitude of peak supercooled water content.
minus10c_level_ft.best_used_for: Defining the worst icing band — freezing level to -10°C level is the danger zone.
minus10c_level_ft.limitations: The actual peak depends on cloud type and moisture. This is a temperature proxy, not a direct measurement of liquid water.

minus20c_level_ft.name: -20°C Level
minus20c_level_ft.vibe: The ice crystal line — clouds are frozen, not wet
minus20c_level_ft.primary_goal: Mark the altitude above which icing risk drops sharply.
minus20c_level_ft.best_used_for: The icing ceiling — above here, most water is already ice crystals.
minus20c_level_ft.limitations: Some supercooled water can persist below -20°C in vigorous convection. Don't treat this as a hard guarantee.

lcl_altitude_ft.name: LCL
lcl_altitude_ft.vibe: The cloud factory floor — where puffs begin
lcl_altitude_ft.primary_goal: Estimate the base of convective clouds.
lcl_altitude_ft.best_used_for: Knowing where cumulus will start forming on a thermal day.
lcl_altitude_ft.limitations: Assumes a surface parcel lifting undisturbed. Actual cloud base depends on whether thermals are strong enough to reach it.

thresholds.label: Low
thresholds.meaning: Low ceiling risk in unstable air.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Typical convective cloud base height.

thresholds.label: High
thresholds.meaning: High cloud bases. Good visibility underneath.

lfc_altitude_ft.name: LFC
lfc_altitude_ft.vibe: The point of no return for a storm
lfc_altitude_ft.primary_goal: Identify the altitude where storms become self-sustaining.
lfc_altitude_ft.best_used_for: Judging how easily convection will fire.
lfc_altitude_ft.limitations: May not exist in stable profiles. When it does exist, a trigger (front, orography, heating) is still needed to push air up to it.

el_altitude_ft.name: EL
el_altitude_ft.vibe: The storm ceiling — where the anvil spreads out
el_altitude_ft.primary_goal: Estimate the top of convective storms.
el_altitude_ft.best_used_for: Knowing how tall storms will get — and whether you can fly over them.
el_altitude_ft.limitations: Theoretical maximum height. Real storm tops depend on entrainment and shear, so actual tops are usually a bit lower.

precipitable_water_mm.name: Precipitable Water
precipitable_water_mm.vibe: The atmospheric sponge — how soaked is the air?
precipitable_water_mm.primary_goal: Measure total moisture in the atmospheric column.
precipitable_water_mm.best_used_for: Gauging how much rain or icing moisture is hiding above you.
precipitable_water_mm.limitations: Climate-dependent. 25mm is extreme for Scotland but ordinary for the Mediterranean in summer. Interpret relative to the region.

thresholds.label: Dry
thresholds.meaning: Light precipitation at most.

thresholds.label: Moist
thresholds.meaning: Moderate rain possible. Icing severity enhanced if in the icing zone.

thresholds.label: Very moist
thresholds.meaning: Heavy precipitation likely. Faster icing accretion rates.

temperature_c.name: Temperature
temperature_c.vibe: The OAT before you leave the hangar
temperature_c.primary_goal: Indicate surface conditions and engine performance.
temperature_c.limitations: Model resolution might miss micro-climates like cold air pooling in a specific valley.

thresholds.label: Standard ops
thresholds.meaning: No surface ice risk.

thresholds.label: Cold
thresholds.meaning: Watch for frost on wings and icy taxiways.

wind_speed_kt.name: Wind
wind_speed_kt.vibe: How hard the air is moving
wind_speed_kt.primary_goal: Indicate wind conditions at the surface or at altitude.
wind_speed_kt.best_used_for: Crosswind limits, headwind/tailwind performance, and turbulence risk.
wind_speed_kt.limitations: Model winds are grid-averaged. Local effects (gusts, channelling) can differ significantly.

thresholds.label: Light
thresholds.meaning: Normal operations.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Check crosswind limits.

thresholds.label: Strong
thresholds.meaning: Significant crosswind/turbulence risk.

wind_direction_deg.name: Wind Direction
wind_direction_deg.vibe: Where the wind is coming from
wind_direction_deg.primary_goal: Indicate wind direction for runway selection and headwind calculation.
wind_direction_deg.best_used_for: Runway selection and crosswind component calculation.
wind_direction_deg.limitations: Model gives direction at grid points. Local terrain effects can alter direction significantly.

cloud_cover_pct.name: Cloud Cover
cloud_cover_pct.limitations: Total column value — doesn't tell you at which altitude the clouds are.

thresholds.label: Few
thresholds.meaning: Mostly clear skies.

thresholds.label: Scattered
thresholds.meaning: Some clouds but VFR likely.

thresholds.label: Broken
thresholds.meaning: Significant cloud. Check ceilings.

thresholds.label: Overcast
thresholds.meaning: Full cloud cover. IFR conditions possible.

precipitation_mm.name: Precipitation
precipitation_mm.vibe: How wet it's going to get
precipitation_mm.best_used_for: Planning for reduced visibility and icing in precipitation.
precipitation_mm.limitations: Model grid averages smooth out local intensity peaks. Thunderstorm rain can be much heavier than shown.

thresholds.label: Dry
thresholds.meaning: Negligible precipitation.

thresholds.label: Light-moderate
thresholds.meaning: Some rain. Visibility may be reduced.

thresholds.label: Heavy
thresholds.meaning: Heavy precipitation. Significant visibility reduction.

max_omega_pa_s.name: Max Omega
max_omega_pa_s.vibe: The invisible hand pushing your plane up or down
max_omega_pa_s.primary_goal: Detect large-scale rising or sinking air.
max_omega_pa_s.best_used_for: Anticipating frontal lift, mountain waves, and large-scale weather development.
max_omega_pa_s.limitations: Represents a grid-cell average. Cannot resolve local rotors, thermals, or microburst-scale features.

thresholds.label: Quiescent
thresholds.meaning: Calm, stable air. Smooth flight.

thresholds.label: Ascent
thresholds.meaning: Synoptic-scale lift. Cloud and precipitation developing.

thresholds.label: Subsidence
thresholds.meaning: Sinking air. Clearing skies, generally smooth.

thresholds.label: Strong ascent
thresholds.meaning: Vigorous vertical motion. Active convection or frontal zone.

thresholds.label: Strong subsidence
thresholds.meaning: Strong sinking. Possible wind shear at inversion.

convective_risk.name: Convective Risk
convective_risk.primary_goal: Summarise the convective risk from all indices.
convective_risk.best_used_for: Quick go/no-go assessment for convective weather.
convective_risk.limitations: Based on CAPE thresholds with CIN modulation. Doesn't account for all trigger mechanisms.

thresholds.label: None
thresholds.meaning: No convective threat.

thresholds.label: Marginal
thresholds.meaning: Shallow convection possible. Scattered showers but no thunderstorms.

thresholds.label: Low
thresholds.meaning: Weak showers possible. Manageable.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Thunderstorms possible with trigger. Plan alternates.

thresholds.label: High
thresholds.meaning: Vigorous storms likely. Significant turbulence.

thresholds.label: Extreme
thresholds.meaning: Severe weather expected. Delay or cancel.

icing_risk.name: Icing Risk
icing_risk.vibe: How fast ice will build on your airframe
icing_risk.primary_goal: Classify the icing severity in a cloud layer.
icing_risk.best_used_for: Deciding whether to enter, avoid, or exit a cloud layer.
icing_risk.limitations: Based on wet-bulb temperature bands. Does not account for droplet size (SLD) or cloud thickness.

thresholds.label: None
thresholds.meaning: No icing concern.

thresholds.label: Light
thresholds.meaning: Manageable for equipped aircraft.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Dangerous — exit clouds if ice persists.

thresholds.label: Severe
thresholds.meaning: Rapid buildup. Exit cloud and change altitude now.

cat_risk.name: CAT Risk
cat_risk.primary_goal: Predict Clear Air Turbulence from Richardson number.
cat_risk.best_used_for: Choosing a smooth flight level — or knowing which ones to avoid.
cat_risk.limitations: Only detects shear-driven turbulence. Blind to mountain waves, convective turbulence, and wake turbulence.

thresholds.label: None
thresholds.meaning: Smooth. Laminar flow.

thresholds.label: Light
thresholds.meaning: Intermittent bumps possible.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Turbulence likely. Unsecured items will move.

thresholds.label: Severe
thresholds.meaning: Shear overwhelms stability — turbulent breakdown. Avoid this layer.

richardson_number.name: Richardson Number
richardson_number.best_used_for: Choosing a smooth flight level — or knowing which ones to avoid.
richardson_number.limitations: Only detects shear-driven turbulence. Blind to mountain waves, convective turbulence, and wake turbulence.

thresholds.label: Smooth
thresholds.meaning: Laminar flow — enjoy the view.

thresholds.label: Light CAT
thresholds.meaning: Approaching critical. Intermittent bumps.

thresholds.label: Moderate CAT
thresholds.meaning: Turbulence likely. Unsecured items will move.

thresholds.label: Severe CAT
thresholds.meaning: Turbulent breakdown. Structural concern at high speed. Avoid.

ogimet_index.name: Ogimet Icing Index
ogimet_index.primary_goal: Physically-based calculation of ice buildup risk.
ogimet_index.best_used_for: The go/no-go decision for flight into clouds in the icing zone.
ogimet_index.limitations: Does not account for droplet size (SLD). Only valid in the 0 to -14°C range (layered) or 0 to -20°C (convective).

thresholds.label: Light
thresholds.meaning: Manageable for equipped aircraft.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Dangerous — exit clouds if ice persists.

thresholds.label: Severe
thresholds.meaning: Rapid buildup. Emergency action — exit cloud now.

vertical_motion_class.name: Vertical Motion
vertical_motion_class.vibe: Is the air going up, down, or sitting still?
vertical_motion_class.primary_goal: Classify the dominant vertical motion regime from omega profiles.
vertical_motion_class.best_used_for: Understanding whether the atmosphere is actively producing weather or is quiet.
vertical_motion_class.limitations: Based on model omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates). Cannot resolve convective-scale updrafts or local effects like mountain waves.

thresholds.label: Quiescent
thresholds.meaning: Calm air. Minimal vertical motion. Smooth flying conditions.

thresholds.label: Synoptic Ascent
thresholds.meaning: Large-scale rising air (frontal or low-pressure). Cloud and precipitation developing.

thresholds.label: Synoptic Subsidence
thresholds.meaning: Large-scale sinking air (high-pressure). Clearing skies, generally smooth.

thresholds.label: Convective
thresholds.meaning: Strong updrafts/downdrafts detected. Turbulence and weather likely.

thresholds.label: Oscillating
thresholds.meaning: Alternating up/down patterns. Possible wave activity or unstable layers.

cloud_coverage.name: Cloud Coverage
cloud_coverage.vibe: How much of the sky is blocked at this level
cloud_coverage.primary_goal: Describe cloud coverage derived from sounding dewpoint depression analysis.
cloud_coverage.best_used_for: Understanding vertical cloud structure — which layers have cloud and how thick.
cloud_coverage.limitations: Derived from 8 pressure levels (coarse). Can miss thin layers. Coverage is estimated from humidity, not observed.

thresholds.label: SCT (Scattered)
thresholds.meaning: 3-4 oktas. Patches of cloud, generally VFR. Sun visible between gaps.

thresholds.label: BKN (Broken)
thresholds.meaning: 5-7 oktas. Mostly cloudy with some breaks. May affect VFR ceiling.

thresholds.label: OVC (Overcast)
thresholds.meaning: 8/8 coverage. Full cloud layer, no gaps. IFR conditions likely if low.

nwp_cloud_cover.name: NWP Cloud Cover
nwp_cloud_cover.vibe: What the weather model directly predicts for cloud
nwp_cloud_cover.primary_goal: Show raw model cloud cover output at three ICAO altitude bands.
nwp_cloud_cover.best_used_for: Comparing model cloud predictions. More reliable than sounding-derived layers for coverage amount.
nwp_cloud_cover.limitations: Total-column percentages per band — doesn't tell you exact cloud base/top. Different models define bands slightly differently.

thresholds.label: Few
thresholds.meaning: Mostly clear at this level.

thresholds.label: Scattered
thresholds.meaning: Some cloud but gaps.

thresholds.label: Broken
thresholds.meaning: Significant cloud.

thresholds.label: Overcast
thresholds.meaning: Full cloud layer.

freezing_level_m.name: Freezing Level
freezing_level_m.vibe: The icing floor — below here, ice melts off
freezing_level_m.primary_goal: Mark the altitude where temperature crosses 0°C.
freezing_level_m.best_used_for: The key reference for icing escape: descend below it to exit the icing zone.
freezing_level_m.limitations: Can be multiple freezing levels in inversions. Model gives one value; real atmosphere can be messier.

thresholds.label: Very low
thresholds.meaning: Freezing near surface. Ground icing, very limited escape options.

thresholds.label: Low
thresholds.meaning: Limited room to descend below icing.

thresholds.label: Moderate
thresholds.meaning: Reasonable icing-free zone below.

thresholds.label: High
thresholds.meaning: Large icing-free zone below.
